page.title: 10THE BLUECOAT C OF E SCHOOL
page.content: The Blue Coat School is in the centre of wotton on the Chipping.The Chipping was the old sheep market buty is now a car park. The school is made from two schools that combined in 1974.These scools were the Blue Coat Charity School,founded in 1715 and the C of E school.The names were combined to give the present school it's new name. On special occasions some pupils dress in the old Blue Coat uniform.This being a blue hat with a yellow pom pom,blue coat with white collar,blue breeches & socks with black buckled shoes.There are 283 pupils.128 Boys and 110 Girls aged 4 to 11.This being 107 Infants 4-7 and 131 Juniors 7-11.The pupils come mostly from Wotton but a few come from Alderly and Tresham.At 11 the Juniors leave to go to Katharine Lady Berkelys School.
